definitions.text: a sorcerer, a magician, a wizard.

(Hebrew), Magog, sometimes as name of a people, sometimes as name of a
                  country in the Old Testament, probably the Scythians; hence: used in apocalyptic
                  literature.

(Hebrew), Midian, generally taken to mean or to include the peninsula
                  of Sinai.
I make disciples, make into disciples

I make a disciple of, train in discipleship; pass: I am trained,
                  discipled, instructed.
(Hebrew) Methuselah, son of Enoch and father of Lamech.
I am raving mad, speak as a madman.
I bless, pronounce blessed or happy.
regarding as happy, blessed, or enviable
regarding as happy, blessed, or enviable.
(Hebrew), Macedonia, a Roman province north of Achaia (Greece).
a Macedonian, an inhabitant of the Roman province Macedonia.
at a distance, far away, remote, alien.
I suffer long, have patience, am forbearing
I suffer long, have patience, am forbearing, perseverance.
long, distant, far; of long duration.
(a) soft, (b) of persons: soft, delicate, effeminate.
Mahalaleel or Maleleel, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Malchus, a servant of the high-priest at Jerusalem.

(Graecized form of Aramaic Menahem), Manaen, probably a member of Herod
                  Antipas' court.

(Hebrew), Manasseh, (a) son of Joseph, founder of a tribe of Israel,
                  (b) son of Hezekiah and father of Amon (Amos).

I learn; with adj. or nouns: I learn to be so and so; with acc. of
                  person who is the object of knowledge; aor. sometimes: to ascertain.

(Hebrew), manna, the supernatural food eaten by the Israelites in the
                  desert: of spiritual food.

I divine, practice soothsaying, suggesting the fraud involved in the
                  practice.
pass: I die, wither (like the grass).

(Aramaic), either: Our Lord hath come, or: Our Lord cometh (will come,
                  is at hand).
Martha, sister of Mary and Lazarus of Bethany.

Mary, Miriam, (a) the mother of Jesus, (b) of Magdala, (c) sister of
                  Martha and Lazarus, (d) wife of Cleopas, (e) mother of John Mark, (f) a Christian
                  woman in Rome.

Mark, who also had the Hebrew name John, son of Mary, nephew of
                  Barnabas, coadjutor of Barnabas, Paul, and Peter.

I witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good
                  report.
I call to witness, testify, solemnly charge

(properly: I call (summon) to witness, and then absolutely) I testify,
                  protest, asseverate; I conjure, solemnly charge.
a witness; an eye- or ear-witness.

I flog, scourge, the victim being strapped to a pole or frame; met: I
                  chastise.

(a) a scourge, lash, of leathern thongs with pieces of metal sewn up in
                  them, (b) met: severe pains (sufferings), disease.
vain, unreal, ineffectual, unproductive; practically: godless.

vanity, emptiness, unreality, purposelessness, ineffectiveness,
                  instability, frailty; false religion.
I become vain or foolish, am perverted.
in vain, in an unreal way, to no purpose.

(earlier: a battle, conflict, hence) in the sphere of words, etc:
                  strife, contention, quarrel.
I engage in battle, fight, strive
I engage in battle, fight; hence: I strive, contend, dispute.
(a) I enlarge, lengthen, (b) I increase, magnify, extol.
large, great, in the widest sense.
a great one, a lord; a courtier, satrap, nobleman.
I translate (from one language into another), interpret.
I move out of its place, transfer

I cause to change its place, move out of its place; I translate,
                  transfer, remove.

(a way of search after something, an inquiry; a method), scheming,
                  craftiness, deceit.
I make drunk; pass: I become drunk.
I am intoxicated with wine, am drunk.
Melea, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
I devise, plan; practice, exercise myself in, study, ponder.
belonging to bees, coming from bees.
I intend, am about to; I delay, linger.
Melchi, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Melchizedek, king and priest of Salem.
it is a care, it concerns
it is a care, it is an object of anxiety, it concerns.
a parchment leaf, perhaps for notes.
blaming one's lot or destiny, discontented, complaining.

an untranslatable particle, generally answered by "de", each of the two
                  introducing a clause intended to be contrasted with the other.
I remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await.

I divide into parts, divide, part, share, distribute; mid: I share,
                  take part in a partitioning; I distract.

I am over-anxious; with acc: I am anxious about, distracted; I care
                  for.
(a) a part, division of a country, (b) a share, portion.

(a) a distributing, a distribution, (b) a parting, dividing, severance,
                  separation.

(lit: midday, hence, the position of the sun at midday), the
                  South.

(a) a mediator, intermediary, (b) a go-between, arbiter, agent of
                  something good.
midnight, the middle of the period between sunset and sunrise.

Mesopotamia, the Country between the (two) Rivers, i.e. the Euphrates
                  and the Tigris.
middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of.
a middle wall, partition wall, barrier.
mid-heaven, the middle of heaven, the zenith.
I am in the middle, am advanced midway.

(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of
                  place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
I leave, depart, remove, pass over
I change my place (abode), leave, depart, remove, pass over.
I change; mid: I change my mind.
I turn about, change the position of

(usually: transfer, transport, and met: to a better mind), I turn
                  about, change the position of; pass: I am brought back.

(lit: I offer by way of change, offer so that a change of owner is
                  produced), I share; sometimes merely: I impart, bestow.
I change my position, depart, remove
I change my position, depart, remove.
mid: I summon to myself, send for.
trans: I move away, dislodge, remove.

(a) with gen: I take a share (part) of, share in, partake of, (b) with
                  acc: I take after (later) or take instead.

(lit: I change one care or interest for another), I change my mind
                  (generally for the better), repent, regret.

I repent, change my mind, change the inner man (particularly with
                  reference to acceptance of the will of God), repent.
repentance, a change of mind, change in the inner man.
I change the outward appearance, transfigure, adapt

I change the outward appearance (the dress, the form of presentment) of
                  something, transfigure; I adapt.

(a) I transfer, mid: I go over to another party, desert, (b) I
                  change.

I have a share of, participate in, share, partake of, am a member
                  of.
I transport, cause to migrate, remove.
a measure, amphora, about 39.39 liters or 8.75 gallons.
I bear gently with, have compassion
I bear gently with, have compassion.
a measure, whether lineal or cubic; a measuring rod.
as far as, until, even to.
by no means, not at all
by no means, not at all.
a Mede, a Median, from east of Assyria.

(a) I reveal, make known (in a law court), I lay information, inform,
                  (b) I make known, point out.
lest at any time, lest, perhaps

lest at any time, lest; then weakened: whether perhaps, whether at all;
                  in a principal clause: perhaps.
lest in any way, lest perhaps
lest in any way, lest perhaps.
if not, unless, whether at all.
a matricide, smiter of his mother.
Miletus, a city on the coast of the Roman province Asia.
a Roman mile, measuring 1478.5 meters or 5820.9 feet.
I remember, call to mind, recall, mention.
I hate, detest, love less, esteem less.

(lit: repayment of price or payment of price due), reward, due
                  punishment.
a paid worker, hired servant, hireling (contrasted with a slave).
(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment.
I hire out, mid: I hire, engage.

Mitylene, the capital of the island of Lesbos in the northern Aegean
                  sea.
a mina, a Greek monetary unit equal to 100 drachma.

Mnason, an early Christian, native of Cyprus, resident at a place
                  between Caesarea and Jerusalem.
I remember, hold in remembrance, make mention of.
I ask in marriage; pass: I am betrothed.
one speaking with difficulty, a stammerer
one speaking with difficulty, a stammerer.
a dry measure, nearly two English gallons
a dry measure, nearly two English gallons.

(a) an adulteress (that is, a married woman who commits adultery), (b)
                  Hebraistically: extended to those who worship any other than the true God.

I commit adultery, not only of a married woman but of a married
                  man.

I commit adultery (of a man with a married woman, but also of a married
                  man).
an adulterer, that is, a man who is guilty with a married woman.
Moloch, a god worshipped by several Semitic peoples.
I soil, stain, pollute, defile, lit. and met.
I make a model of a calf
I make an image of a calf.
skilled in music; subst: a musician, singer.
I initiate, instruct; pass: I am disciplined, learn (a lesson).
an idle tale, fable, fanciful story.

(properly: I turn up the nose as a sign of contempt), I sneer at,
                  disdain.
a mill-house, the place where grain was ground.
Myra, a port in Lycia, south-west Asia Minor.
a myriad, group of ten thousand, a ten thousand.
ten thousand; also used for a very large number, innumerable.

Mysia, a country in the north-west of the Roman province Asia (and of
                  Asia Minor).

a mystery, secret, of which initiation is necessary; in the NT: the
                  counsels of God, once hidden but now revealed in the Gospel or some fact thereof;
                  the Christian revelation generally; particular truths or details of the Christian
                  revelation.
I am short-sighted, blink, see dimly.
a bruise, stripe, left on the body by scourging.
I blame, find fault with, slander.
I make foolish, taint, make useless

(a) I make foolish, turn to foolishness, (b) I taint, and thus: I am
                  tasteless, make useless.
(a) adj: stupid, foolish, (b) noun: a fool.
Moses; met: the books of Moses, the Pentateuch.
